alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 11:06AM CDT until May 09 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT FOR ROOKS...WESTERN JEWELL...SMITH...NORTHERN OSBORNE...SOUTHEASTERN PHILLIPS...SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 1106 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles south of Riverton to near Gaylord to near Palco, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters up to quarter size hail in Palco and 60 MPH winds were reported at Smith Center. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Cedar around 1110 AM CDT. Gaylord around 1115 AM CDT. Harlan around 1125 AM CDT. Portis around 1135 AM CDT. Plainville around 1140 AM CDT. Downs and Codell around 1145 AM CDT. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
